alert.note: Alert for Edwards; Kinney; Real; Val Verde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 04 at 3:25PM CDT until April 05 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE RIO GRANDE PLAINS AND SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU ON TUESDAY DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WEST WINDS... .Gusty west winds and dry air will move into the region Tuesday afternoon. In addition, hot temperatures along with the dry air will result in very low afternoon humidity levels in the single digits. Fire danger remains very high across the region. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY TUESDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR VAL VERDE...EDWARDS...REAL AND KINNEY COUNTIES... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * WINDS...West 10 to 20 mph with gusts near 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 11 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires ignited may spread rapidly and unpredictably. Prevention of fire starts by avoiding planned burning, or by limiting activities prone to produce sparks. Take care to stop the start and spread of wildfires.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
